title: Aaron Brown (rugby league)
text:
Aaron Brown (born 27 July 1992) is a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Second-row">second row</a> or <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Loose-forward">loose forward</a> for the <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Brown signed for the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> in October 2012 having previously being named as the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> U20 player of the year.
In October 2018 Brown joined Sheffield Eagles on a two-year deal. He helped the Eagles by scoring a hat-trick of tries, to win the inaugural <a href="RFL%201895%20Cup">1895 Cup</a> as they defeated <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> 36–18 in the final.
